name: Docker
description: Build or push Docker images, login or logout, or run a Docker command. Task can be used with Docker registry.
author: Microsoft Corporation
releaseNotes:
Simplified the task YAML by:
 - Removing the Container registry type input
 - Removing complex inputs as they can be passed as arguments to the command.

inputs.name: containerRegistry
inputs.label: Container registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker registry service connection. Required for commands that need to authenticate with a registry.

inputs.name: buildContext
inputs.label: Build context
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the build context. If not specified, it defaults to the directory that contains the Dockerfile.

inputs.name: tags
inputs.visibleRule: command = build || command = push || command = buildAndPush
inputs.label: Tags
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A list of tags in separate lines. These tags are used in build, push and buildAndPush commands. Ex:

beta1.1
latest

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.visibleRule: command != login && command != logout && command != buildAndPush
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Docker command options. Ex:
For build command,
--build-arg HTTP_PROXY=http://10.20.30.2:1234 --quiet

outputVariables.name: DockerOutput
outputVariables.description: The path of the file(s) which contains the output of the command

messages.AddingAuthDataToDockerConfig: Adding auth data for registry to Docker config file. Registry: %s, Docker config: %s
messages.ArgumentsNotSupportedWithBuildAndPush: The input arguments is not supported when the command is buildAndPush
messages.ContainerPatternFound: Pattern found in Docker filepath parameter
messages.ContainerPatternNotFound: No pattern found in Docker filepath parameter
messages.CantWriteDataToFile: Can not write data to the file %s. Error: %s
messages.CouldNotFindDockerConfig: Could not find Docker Config. Either DOCKER_CONFIG variable is not set, or the config file is outside the temp directory, or the file does not exist. Docker config directory: %s, Docker config path: %s
messages.DeletingAuthDataFromDockerConfig: Deleting auth data for registry from Docker config file. Registry: %s, New Docker config: %s
messages.DockerRegistryNotFound: Docker registry service connection not specified.
messages.FileContentSynced: Synced the file content to the disk. The content is %s.
messages.FoundDockerConfigStoredInTempPath: Found the Docker Config stored in the temp path. Docker config path: %s, Docker config: %s
messages.FoundPreviousLogin: Found a previous login for the registry. Trying to restore the previous login auth data. Registry: %s
messages.FoundLoginsForOtherRegistries: Found login info for other registry(s). Trying to remove auth from the Docker config for the registry: %s
messages.FoundPreviousLoginForRegistry: Found a previous login to the same registry. Saving old login data and continuing with the new login. Previous login auth: %s
messages.LoggingOutWithNoRegistrySpecified: Logging out. Removing all auth data from temp docker config since no registry is specified.
messages.NoDataWrittenOnFile: No data was written into the file %s
messages.NoImagesInImageNamesFile: At least one image name is expected in file '%s'.
messages.NotAddingAnyTagsToBuild: Not adding any container registry tags to the build image as no login information was found.
messages.NotPushingAsNoLoginFound: Not pushing to any registry as no login information was found.
messages.OutputVariableDataSizeExceeded: Output variable not set as Docker command output exceeded the maximum supported length. Output length: %s, Maximum supported length: %s
messages.PathIsNotInTempDirectory: The config path is not inside the temp directory. Config path: %s, Temp directory: %s
messages.RegistryAuthNotPresentInConfig: Could not find the auth data for registry in the Docker config file. Unable to logout. Registry: %s, Docker config: %s
messages.RestoringPreviousLoginAuth: Restoring the previous login auth. Docker config: %s
